intro: Tylophora parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Tylophora parviflora is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
